tags.name: Scan Operations
tags.description: Read records in specified namespace, set.

tags.name: Key Value Operations
tags.description: Perform simple operations on a single record.

tags.name: Query Operations
tags.description: Read records in specified namespace, set.

tags.name: Cluster information operations
tags.description: Retrieve basic information about the Aerospike cluster.

tags.name: Info Operations
tags.description: Send info commands to nodes in the Aerospike cluster.

tags.name: Document API Operations
tags.description: Perform operations on records using JSONPath queries.

tags.name: Truncate Operations
tags.description: Remove multiple records from the server.

tags.name: Batch Operations
tags.description: Retrieve multiple records from the server.

tags.name: Operate operations
tags.description: Perform multiple operations atomically on a single record.

get.summary: Return the metadata and bins for a record.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Namespace for the record; equivalent to database name.

parameters.name: set
parameters.description: Set for the record; equivalent to database table.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Userkey for the record.

parameters.name: keytype
parameters.description: The Type of the userKey.

parameters.name: recordBins
parameters.description: Optionally specify a set of bins to return when fetching a record. If omitted, all bins will be returned.

parameters.name: sendKey
parameters.description: Send user defined key in addition to hash digest on both reads and writes.

parameters.name: replica
parameters.description: Replica algorithm used to determine the target node for a single record command.

parameters.name: readModeSC
parameters.description: Read policy for SC (strong consistency) namespaces. Determines SC read consistency options.

parameters.name: readModeAP
parameters.description: Read policy for AP (availability) namespaces. How duplicates should be consulted in a read operation. Only makes a difference during migrations and only applicable in AP mode.

parameters.name: totalTimeout
parameters.description: Total transaction timeout in milliseconds.

parameters.name: socketTimeout
parameters.description: Socket idle timeout in milliseconds when processing a database command.

parameters.name: sleepBetweenRetries
parameters.description: Milliseconds to sleep between retries.

parameters.name: maxRetries
parameters.description:
Maximum number of retries before aborting the current transaction.
The initial attempt is not counted as a retry.

parameters.name: filterexp
parameters.description: Optional Filter Expression (introduced in Aerospike Database 5.2.0) in infix notation DSL.

parameters.name: compress
parameters.description: Use zlib compression on command buffers sent to the server and responses received from the server when the buffer size is greater than 128 bytes.

500.description: REST Client encountered an error while processing the request.

403.description: Not authorized to access the resource

200.description: Metadata and bins for a record returned successfully.

put.summary: Replace the bins of the specified record.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Namespace for the record; equivalent to database name.

parameters.name: set
parameters.description: Set for the record; equivalent to database table.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Userkey for the record.

parameters.name: keytype
parameters.description: The Type of the userKey.

parameters.name: expiration
parameters.description: Record expiration. Also known as ttl (time to live). Seconds record will live before being removed by the server.

parameters.name: generation
parameters.description: Expected generation. Generation is the number of times a record has been modified (including creation) on the server.

parameters.name: durableDelete
parameters.description: If the transaction results in a record deletion, leave a tombstone for the record.

parameters.name: respondAllOps
parameters.description: For client operate(), return a result for every operation.

parameters.name: commitLevel
parameters.description: Desired consistency guarantee when committing a transaction on the server.

parameters.name: generationPolicy
parameters.description: Qualify how to handle record writes based on record generation.

parameters.name: recordExistsAction
parameters.description: How to handle the existence of the record. This is ignored for POST/PUT/UPDATE kvs methods.

parameters.name: sendKey
parameters.description: Send user defined key in addition to hash digest on both reads and writes.

parameters.name: replica
parameters.description: Replica algorithm used to determine the target node for a single record command.

parameters.name: readModeSC
parameters.description: Read policy for SC (strong consistency) namespaces. Determines SC read consistency options.

parameters.name: readModeAP
parameters.description: Read policy for AP (availability) namespaces. How duplicates should be consulted in a read operation. Only makes a difference during migrations and only applicable in AP mode.

parameters.name: totalTimeout
parameters.description: Total transaction timeout in milliseconds.

parameters.name: socketTimeout
parameters.description: Socket idle timeout in milliseconds when processing a database command.

parameters.name: sleepBetweenRetries
parameters.description: Milliseconds to sleep between retries.

parameters.name: maxRetries
parameters.description:
Maximum number of retries before aborting the current transaction.
The initial attempt is not counted as a retry.

parameters.name: filterexp
parameters.description: Optional Filter Expression (introduced in Aerospike Database 5.2.0) in infix notation DSL.

parameters.name: compress
parameters.description: Use zlib compression on command buffers sent to the server and responses received from the server when the buffer size is greater than 128 bytes.

requestBody.description:
Bins to be stored in the record. This is a mapping from a string bin name to a value. Value can be a String, integer, floating point number, list, map, bytearray, or GeoJSON value. Bytearrays and GeoJSON can only be sent using MessagePack
 example: {"bin1":5, "bin2":"hello", "bin3": [1,2,3], "bin4": {"one": 1}}

500.description: REST Client encountered an error while processing the request.

403.description: Not authorized to access the resource

204.description: Modified record successfully, no content expected.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Namespace for the record; equivalent to database name.

parameters.name: keytype
parameters.description: The Type of the userKey.

parameters.name: allowInline
parameters.description: Allow batch to be processed immediately in the server's receiving thread when the server deems it to be appropriate.  If false, the batch will always be processed in separate transaction threads.  This field is only relevant for the new batch index protocol.

parameters.name: allowInlineSSD
parameters.description:
Allow batch to be processed immediately in the server's receiving thread for SSD namespaces. If false, the batch will always be processed in separate service threads. Server versions < 6.0 ignore this field.
Inline processing can introduce the possibility of unfairness because the server can process the entire batch before moving onto the next command.

parameters.name: maxConcurrentThreads
parameters.description: Maximum number of concurrent synchronous batch request threads to server nodes at any point in time. If there are 16 node/namespace combinations requested and maxConcurrentThreads is 8, then batch requests will be made for 8 node/namespace combinations in parallel threads. When a request completes, a new request will be issued until all 16 requests are complete.

parameters.name: respondAllKeys
parameters.description:
Should all batch keys be attempted regardless of errors. This field is used on both the client and server. The client handles node specific errors and the server handles key specific errors.
If true, every batch key is attempted regardless of previous key specific errors. Node specific errors such as timeouts stop keys to that node, but keys directed at other nodes will continue to be processed.
If false, the server will stop the batch to its node on most key specific errors. The exceptions are com.aerospike.client.ResultCode.KEY_NOT_FOUND_ERROR and com.aerospike.client.ResultCode.FILTERED_OUT which never stop the batch. The client will stop the entire batch on node specific errors for sync commands that are run in sequence (maxConcurrentThreads == 1). The client will not stop the entire batch for async commands or sync commands run in parallel.
Server versions < 6.0 do not support this field and treat this value as false for key specific errors.

parameters.name: durableDelete
parameters.description: If the transaction results in a record deletion, leave a tombstone for the record.

parameters.name: respondAllOps
parameters.description: For client operate(), return a result for every operation.

parameters.name: commitLevel
parameters.description: Desired consistency guarantee when committing a transaction on the server.

parameters.name: generationPolicy
parameters.description: Qualify how to handle record writes based on record generation.

parameters.name: recordExistsAction
parameters.description: How to handle the existence of the record. This is ignored for POST/PUT/UPDATE kvs methods.

parameters.name: sendKey
parameters.description: Send user defined key in addition to hash digest on both reads and writes.

parameters.name: replica
parameters.description: Replica algorithm used to determine the target node for a single record command.

parameters.name: readModeSC
parameters.description: Read policy for SC (strong consistency) namespaces. Determines SC read consistency options.

parameters.name: readModeAP
parameters.description: Read policy for AP (availability) namespaces. How duplicates should be consulted in a read operation. Only makes a difference during migrations and only applicable in AP mode.

parameters.name: totalTimeout
parameters.description: Total transaction timeout in milliseconds.

parameters.name: socketTimeout
parameters.description: Socket idle timeout in milliseconds when processing a database command.

parameters.name: sleepBetweenRetries
parameters.description: Milliseconds to sleep between retries.

parameters.name: maxRetries
parameters.description:
Maximum number of retries before aborting the current transaction.
The initial attempt is not counted as a retry.

parameters.name: filterexp
parameters.description: Optional Filter Expression (introduced in Aerospike Database 5.2.0) in infix notation DSL.

parameters.name: compress
parameters.description: Use zlib compression on command buffers sent to the server and responses received from the server when the buffer size is greater than 128 bytes.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Namespace for the record; equivalent to database name.

parameters.name: maxConcurrentNodes
parameters.description:
Maximum number of concurrent requests to server nodes at any point in time. If there are 16 nodes in the cluster and maxConcurrentNodes is 8, then scan requests will be made to 8 nodes in parallel.  When a scan completes, a new scan request will be issued until all 16 nodes have been scanned.
This field is only relevant when concurrentNodes is true.

parameters.name: includeBinData
parameters.description: Should bin data be retrieved. If false, only record digests (and user keys if stored on the server) are retrieved.

parameters.name: failOnClusterChange
parameters.description: Terminate query if cluster is in migration state. If the server supports partition queries or the query filter is null (scan), this field is ignored.

parameters.name: shortQuery
parameters.description: Is query expected to return less than 100 records. If true, the server will optimize the query for a small record set. This field is ignored for aggregation queries, background queries and server versions < 6.0.

parameters.name: indexName
parameters.description: Optional query index filter. This filter is applied to the secondary index on query. Query index filters must reference a bin which has a secondary index defined.

parameters.name: maxRecords
parameters.description: Number of records to return. Required for pagination. This number is divided by the number of nodes involved in the query. The actual number of records returned may be less than maxRecords if node record counts are small and unbalanced across nodes.

parameters.name: recordsPerSecond
parameters.description: Should bin data be retrieved. If false, only record digests (and user keys if stored on the server) are retrieved.

parameters.name: sendKey
parameters.description: Send user defined key in addition to hash digest on both reads and writes.

parameters.description: Read policy for AP (availability) namespaces. How duplicates should be consulted in a read operation. Only makes a difference during migrations and only applicable in AP mode.

parameters.name: filterexp
parameters.description: Optional Filter Expression (introduced in Aerospike Database 5.2.0) in infix notation DSL.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Namespace for the record; equivalent to database name.

parameters.name: keytype
parameters.description: The Type of the userKey.

parameters.name: allowInline
parameters.description: Allow batch to be processed immediately in the server's receiving thread when the server deems it to be appropriate.  If false, the batch will always be processed in separate transaction threads.  This field is only relevant for the new batch index protocol.

parameters.name: allowInlineSSD
parameters.description:
Allow batch to be processed immediately in the server's receiving thread for SSD namespaces. If false, the batch will always be processed in separate service threads. Server versions < 6.0 ignore this field.
Inline processing can introduce the possibility of unfairness because the server can process the entire batch before moving onto the next command.

parameters.name: maxConcurrentThreads
parameters.description: Maximum number of concurrent synchronous batch request threads to server nodes at any point in time. If there are 16 node/namespace combinations requested and maxConcurrentThreads is 8, then batch requests will be made for 8 node/namespace combinations in parallel threads. When a request completes, a new request will be issued until all 16 requests are complete.

parameters.name: respondAllKeys
parameters.description:
Should all batch keys be attempted regardless of errors. This field is used on both the client and server. The client handles node specific errors and the server handles key specific errors.
If true, every batch key is attempted regardless of previous key specific errors. Node specific errors such as timeouts stop keys to that node, but keys directed at other nodes will continue to be processed.
If false, the server will stop the batch to its node on most key specific errors. The exceptions are com.aerospike.client.ResultCode.KEY_NOT_FOUND_ERROR and com.aerospike.client.ResultCode.FILTERED_OUT which never stop the batch. The client will stop the entire batch on node specific errors for sync commands that are run in sequence (maxConcurrentThreads == 1). The client will not stop the entire batch for async commands or sync commands run in parallel.
Server versions < 6.0 do not support this field and treat this value as false for key specific errors.

parameters.description: Send user defined key in addition to hash digest on both reads and writes.

parameters.name: readModeAP
parameters.description: Read policy for AP (availability) namespaces. How duplicates should be consulted in a read operation. Only makes a difference during migrations and only applicable in AP mode.

post.summary: Return multiple records from the server in a single request.

parameters.name: allowInline
parameters.description: Allow batch to be processed immediately in the server's receiving thread when the server deems it to be appropriate.  If false, the batch will always be processed in separate transaction threads.  This field is only relevant for the new batch index protocol.

parameters.name: allowInlineSSD
parameters.description:
Allow batch to be processed immediately in the server's receiving thread for SSD namespaces. If false, the batch will always be processed in separate service threads. Server versions < 6.0 ignore this field.
Inline processing can introduce the possibility of unfairness because the server can process the entire batch before moving onto the next command.

parameters.name: maxConcurrentThreads
parameters.description: Maximum number of concurrent synchronous batch request threads to server nodes at any point in time. If there are 16 node/namespace combinations requested and maxConcurrentThreads is 8, then batch requests will be made for 8 node/namespace combinations in parallel threads. When a request completes, a new request will be issued until all 16 requests are complete.

parameters.name: respondAllKeys
parameters.description:
Should all batch keys be attempted regardless of errors. This field is used on both the client and server. The client handles node specific errors and the server handles key specific errors.
If true, every batch key is attempted regardless of previous key specific errors. Node specific errors such as timeouts stop keys to that node, but keys directed at other nodes will continue to be processed.
If false, the server will stop the batch to its node on most key specific errors. The exceptions are com.aerospike.client.ResultCode.KEY_NOT_FOUND_ERROR and com.aerospike.client.ResultCode.FILTERED_OUT which never stop the batch. The client will stop the entire batch on node specific errors for sync commands that are run in sequence (maxConcurrentThreads == 1). The client will not stop the entire batch for async commands or sync commands run in parallel.
Server versions < 6.0 do not support this field and treat this value as false for key specific errors.

AddOperation.description: Increment the value of an item in the specified `binName` by the value of `incr`

type.description: The type of operation. It is always ADD

AppendOperation.description: Append a `value` to the item in the specified `binName`

type.description: The type of operation. It is always APPEND

BitAddOperation.description: Server adds value to byte[] bin starting at bitOffset for bitSize. BitSize must be <= 64. Signed indicates if bits should be treated as a signed number. If add overflows/underflows, BitOverflowAction is used. Server does not return a value.

type.description: The type of operation. It is always BIT_ADD

BitAndOperation.description: Server performs bitwise "and" on value and byte[] bin at bitOffset for bitSize.

type.description: The type of operation. It is always BIT_AND

BitCountOperation.description: Server returns integer count of set bits from byte[] bin starting at bitOffset for bitSize.

type.description: The type of operation. It is always BIT_COUNT

BitGetIntOperation.description: Server returns integer from byte[] bin starting at bitOffset for bitSize. Signed indicates if bits should be treated as a signed number.

type.description: The type of operation. It is always BIT_GET_INT

BitGetOperation.description: Server returns bits from byte[] bin starting at bitOffset for bitSize.

type.description: The type of operation. It is always BIT_GET

BitInsertOperation.description: Server inserts value bytes into byte[] bin at byteOffset. Server does not return a value.

type.description: The type of operation. It is always BIT_INSERT

BitLScanOperation.description: Server returns integer bit offset of the first specified value bit in byte[] bin starting at bitOffset for bitSize.

type.description: The type of operation. It is always BIT_LSCAN

BitLShiftOperation.description: Server shifts left byte[] bin starting at bitOffset for bitSize. Server does not return a value.

type.description: The type of operation. It is always BIT_LSHIFT

BitNotOperation.description: Server negates byte[] bin starting at bitOffset for bitSize. Server does not return a value.

type.description: The type of operation. It is always BIT_NOT

BitOperation.description: The base type for describing all bit operations. Should not be used directly.

BitOrOperation.description: Server performs bitwise "or" on value and byte[] bin at bitOffset for bitSize. Server does not return a value.

type.description: The type of operation. It is always BIT_OR

BitRScanOperation.description: Server returns integer bit offset of the last specified value bit in byte[] bin starting at bitOffset for bitSize.

type.description: The type of operation. It is always BIT_RSCAN

BitRShiftOperation.description: Server shifts right byte[] bin starting at bitOffset for bitSize. Server does not return a value.

type.description: The type of operation. It is always BIT_LSHIFT

BitRemoveOperation.description: Server removes bytes from byte[] bin at byteOffset for byteSize. Server does not return a value.

type.description: The type of operation. It is always BIT_REMOVE

BitResizeOperation.description: Server resizes byte[] to byteSize according to resizeFlags (See BitResizeFlags). Server does not return a value.

type.description: The type of operation. It is always BIT_RESIZE

BitSetIntOperation.description: Server sets value to byte[] bin starting at bitOffset for bitSize. Size must be <= 64. Server does not return a value.

type.description: The type of operation. It is always BIT_SET_INT

BitSetOperation.description: Server sets value on byte[] bin at bitOffset for bitSize. Server does not return a value.

type.description: The type of operation. It is always BIT_SET

BitSubtractOperation.description: Server subtracts value from byte[] bin starting at bitOffset for bitSize. BitSize must be <= 64. Signed indicates if bits should be treated as a signed number. If add overflows/underflows, BitOverflowAction is used. Server does not return a value.

type.description: The type of operation. It is always BIT_SUBTRACT

BitXOrOperation.description: Server performs bitwise "xor" on value and byte[] bin at bitOffset for bitSize.

type.description: The type of operation. It is always BIT_XOR

CTX.description: The base type for describing a nested CDT context. Identifies the location of nested list/map to apply the operation.

type.description: The type of operation. It is always DELETE
The type of operation. It is always GET_HEADER

GetOperation.description: Return the contents of a record

type.description: The type of operation. It is always GET

HLLAddOperation.description: Server adds values to HLL set. If HLL bin does not exist, use indexBitCount and optionally minHashBitCount to create HLL bin. Server returns number of entries that caused HLL to update a register.

type.description: The type of operation. It is always HLL_ADD

HLLDescribeOperation.description: Server returns indexBitCount and minHashBitCount used to create HLL bin in a list of longs. The list size is 2.

type.description: The type of operation. It is always HLL_DESCRIBE

HLLFoldOperation.description: Servers folds indexBitCount to the specified value. This can only be applied when minHashBitCount on the HLL bin is 0. Server does not return a value.

type.description: The type of operation. It is always HLL_FOLD

HLLGetCountOperation.description: Server returns estimated number of elements in the HLL bin.

type.description: The type of operation. It is always HLL_COUNT

HLLGetIntersectionCountOperation.description: Server returns estimated number of elements that would be contained by the intersection of these HLL objects.

type.description: The type of operation. It is always HLL_INTERSECT_COUNT

HLLGetSimilarityOperation.description: Server returns estimated similarity of these HLL objects. Return type is a double.

HLLGetUnionCountOperation.description: Server returns estimated number of elements that would be contained by the union of these HLL objects.

HLLGetUnionOperation.description: Server returns an HLL object that is the union of all specified HLL objects in the list with the HLL bin.

HLLInitOperation.description: Server creates a new HLL or resets an existing HLL. Server does not return a value.

HLLOperation.description: The base type for describing all HLL operations. Should not be used directly.

HLLSetUnionOperation.description: Server sets union of specified HLL objects with HLL bin. Server does not return a value.

ListGetByIndexOperation.description: Return an item, located a specific index, from a list in the specified bin. The value of `listReturnType` determines what will be returned. Requires Aerospike Server `3.16.0.1` or greater.

type.description: The type of operation. It is always LIST_GET_BY_INDEX

ListGetByIndexRangeOperation.description: Return a specified amount of items beginning at a specific index, from a list in the specified bin. If `count` is not provided, all items from `index` until the end of the list will be returned. Requires Aerospike Server `3.16.0.1` or later

type.description: The type of operation. It is always LIST_GET_BY_RANK

BatchDelete.description: An object that describes a batch delete operation to be used in a batch request.

type.description: The type of batch request. It is always DELETE

filterExp.description: Optional expression filter. If filterExp exists and evaluates to false, the specific batch key request is not performed and RecordClientBatchRecordResponse.ResultCode is set to FILTERED_OUT. If exists, this filter overrides the batch parent policy filterExp for the specific key in batch commands that allow a different policy per key. Otherwise, this filter is ignored.

commitLevel.description: Desired consistency guarantee when committing a transaction on the server. The default (COMMIT_ALL) indicates that the server should wait for master and all replica commits to be successful before returning success to the client.

generationPolicy.description: Qualify how to handle record deletes based on record generation. The default (NONE) indicates that the generation is not used to restrict deletes.

generation.description:
Expected generation. Generation is the number of times a record has been modified (including creation) on the server.
This field is only relevant when generationPolicy is not NONE.

durableDelete.description: If the transaction results in a record deletion, leave a tombstone for the record. This prevents deleted records from reappearing after node failures. Valid for Aerospike Server Enterprise Edition only.

sendKey.description: Send user defined key in addition to hash digest. If true, the key will be stored with the record on the server.

BatchDeletePolicy.description: An object that describes a policy for a delete operation used in a batch request.

BatchRead.description: An object that describes a batch read operation to be used in a batch request.

type.description: The type of batch request. It is always READ

readModeAP.description: Read policy for AP (availability) namespaces. How duplicates should be consulted in a read operation. Only makes a difference during migrations and only applicable in AP mode.

commitLevel.description: Desired consistency guarantee when committing a transaction on the server. The default (COMMIT_ALL) indicates that the server should wait for master and all replica commits to be successful before returning success to the client.

expiration.description:
Record expiration. Also known as ttl (time to live). Seconds record will live before being removed by the server.
Expiration values:
   1. -2: Do not change ttl when record is updated.
   2. -1: Never expire.
   3. 0: Default to namespace configuration variable "default-ttl" on the server.
   4. greater than 0: Actual ttl in seconds.
